intro: Corispermum sabulosum, commonly known as the sandy corisperm, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in sandy or coastal environments. The plant has simple, linear leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its seeds are enclosed in small, capsule-like fruits, which are characteristic of the family. Corispermum sabulosum is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in dunes or salt marshes.
